http.html:
The Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea
Skip to menu: Services, MyRBKC, Council, Maps Skip to search box
  • Services
  • See a full list of services below
  • MyRBKC
  • Council
  • Maps

Welcome to the Royal Borough

Popular links

  • Make a payment
  • MyRBKC Sign in
  • Report a problem
  • Find a job
  • Find my bin collection day
  • Apply for a parking permit
  • Renew a library book
  • See A-Z contact directory
  • Find my nearest
  • See more things to do

Services

  • Advice and benefitsCheck your eligibility for benefits and get advice on how to make a claim.
  • Bins and recyclingFind information on rubbish collections, recycling centres and bulky waste.
  • Births, deaths, marriages and citizenshipInformation on marriages and civil partnerships, registering births and deaths, bereavement and cemetery services and citizenship.
  • Business and enterprisePay your business rates, plus information on our Public Health Training Service and fraud awareness.
  • Children and educationFind out how to join or move schools, the Family Information Service and our local offer for children with special educational needs and disabilities.
  • Community and local lifeInformation on Resident Associations and other community groups, volunteering, community safety, and how to get involved in local life.
  • Council taxFind out how to register for council tax and ways to pay or to notify us about a change in address.
  • Council, councillors and democracyFind out how the Council works, information on the mayor and civic events, our councillors, consultations, petitions, the Constitution and elections.
  • EnvironmentEnvironmental health services including health and safety, pest control and food hygiene.
  • Grenfell response and recoveryInformation about the Council’s Grenfell Recovery Strategy and how it’s being delivered with the community. You can also access Grenfell-related policies.
  • Health and social careInformation on health and social care services including adoption, fostering, the Local Safeguarding Children Board and People First.
  • HousingInformation on housing in the borough, including applying for housing, benefits, private sector housing and support with homelessness.
  • JobsWorking with the Royal Borough
  • Leisure and cultureFind out about sports and leisure, filming and special events, culture services and markets.
  • LibrariesFind your nearest library, search the catalogue, become a member, and access online services.
  • LicensingApply for a licence, view an existing licence, or view information on policies or initiatives.
  • New residentsA guide to the essential things you may need as you move into your new home.
  • Parking, transport and streetsInformation about parking in the borough including disabled parking schemes, parking suspensions and paying and challenging parking tickets.
  • Parks, gardens and ecologyInformation on the borough's parks, open spaces and Holland Park Ecology Centre.
  • Planning and building controlApply, search, view and comment on planning applications.

View all

Latest news

Kensington and Chelsea Council Tax agreed for 2019/2020

The budget includes maintaining twice weekly bin collections, supporting our ageing population, and spending £5m supporting the police. Council tax for a Band D property will increase by £3.43 per month.

Dalgarno ward by-election candidates

There are five candidates standing for election in the Dalgarno ward by-election on Thursday 21 March. There is one seat available.

Chief executive on the future of Kensington and Chelsea College

The Council's Chief Executive, Barry Quirk, has written to the Further Education Commissioner at the Department for Education to outline the Council’s position and to ask for a transparent and consultative process in deciding the future of Kensington and Chelsea College. Because the Council has been working with community groups on this project, we are publishing our correspondence.

Visit the newsroom for more updates

Grenfell Response and Recovery

Grenfell Response and Recovery

The Grenfell Response and Recovery service will keep you updated on the Council’s Grenfell Recovery Strategy and how it’s being delivered with the community. You can also access Grenfell-related policies.

Read more
